name: Multi-electrode array recordings of rat retinal ganglion cells with LED stimulation for retinotectal cell identification via ReaChR phototagging
citation: Rudzite, Andra (2025) Multi-electrode array recordings of rat retinal ganglion cells with LED stimulation for retinotectal cell identification via ReaChR phototagging (Version 0.251202.2310) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://doi.org/10.48324/dandi.001677/0.251202.2310
description:
Retinal tissue was obtained from Long-Evans rats that received stereotactic injections of AAV2retro-CAG-ReaChR-mCitrine into the superior colliculus. This retrograde viral approach resulted in expression of the red-shifted channelrhodopsin ReaChR and the fluorophore mCitrine in retinotectal RGCs.
Ex vivo retinal recordings were performed on 512-electrode arrays following pharmacological blockade of photoreceptor-mediated responses using L-AP4, DL-AP5, and CNQX. LED flashes at 565 nm were delivered at multiple intensities and durations (10, 30, 100, and 200 ms) to selectively activate ReaChR-expressing cells. The dataset contains recordings from 6 experiments, each capturing responses from hundreds of RGCs to the LED stimulation protocol.
